result.execSummary:
The defendant Nina V. Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Taycheedah Correctional Institution as the reception center. Court has ruled that the Defendant is eligible for ERP (Earned Release Program) but not Substance Abuse Program. Counsel have stipulated to the sentence credit: 530 days.

Conditions: Cooperate with assessment and treatment programs. Submit DNA sample if not previously obtained. Pay costs and supervision fees. Pay restitution of $2537.91 to the victim. No contact with victim.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing Transcript 2/16/17

Court's response to DOC's request for review of sentence credit: Court determines that, as credit of 530 days, was set by stipulation of the parties during the sentencing proceeding, that is the correct amount of credit; no amendment is needed.
4/13/17 letter from DOC to the Court - request for amendment of JOC stating that Def is not eliglble for CIP or SAP. Court so orders; judgment to be amended by the clerk.

09:17am Defendant Nina V. Fields in court, in custody, with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. PSI were each submitted by Jacqueline M. Miller and Dustin Popp and both parties received copies of the PSI. PSI corrections noted by the State and Defense. Comments on corrections, modifications to the Alternative PSI. Impact statements made by persons on behalf of the victim. Witness KP sworn and testified. Witness KJ sworn and testified. Witness MF sworn and testified. State calls victim to testify. Court takes short recess.

Court resumes at 11:03am.  Defense does not have any statements or evidence to present. DA argues State's position for the sentence-asks for maximum (60 years total sentence with the Wisconsin State Prison system: 40 years initial confinement, 20 years extended supervision). State also asks all the recommendation from the PSI for extended supervision be incorporated with 530 days credit by stipulation, restitution to the victim in the amount of $2537.91, and asks the Court to adopt the State's recommendation. Court breaks for lunch.

Court resumes at 1:18pm. Atty Longacre argues on behalf of the Defense. Def addresses the Court. 

State PSI recommends 20 years initial confinement/6 years extended supervision.  Alternative PSI recommends initial confinement 25 years, 10 years extended supervision.

Court rules: sentencing def to the recommendation of the State PSI-35 years total sentence in the Wisconsin Prison System, 25 years in initial confinement/10 years of Extended Supervision. Designate Taycheedah Correctional Institution as the reception center. Not eligible for any substance abuse treatment programs. Eligible for Earned Release. 

Conditions of ES: Must cooperate with assessment and treatment programs, submit DNA sample if not previously obtained, payment of costs, restitution to be paid in the amount of $2537.91 to the victim, no contact with victim, payment of supervision fees. 

Sentence credit of 530 days by stipulation.
Motion to amend PSI and Alternative PSI
Plea Hearing 12-7-16
Independent Presentence Investigation filed by the Defense
(AMENDED - reflects the Class B modifier status of the charge)
Sentencing hearing on February 16, 2017 at 09:00 am.

2:16 p.m. Defendant Nina V. Fields in court, in custody, with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA informs the Court that the parties have reached a resolution in which Def will be entering a no contest in the form of a specialized Alford plea, pleading to the charge as stated in the complaint and the information; parties will be asking for PSI and argued sentencing date.  Atty. Longacre presents the Court with plea questionnaire.  DA confirms compliance with victim's rights.  

Def pleads no contest on basis of Alford.  Court's colloquy with def on meaning of "Alford plea."  Def is maintaining her innocence but acknowledges that her Alford plea will have the same result as a plea of guilty. Further colloquy.  Clarification stated re Def's Alford plea:  While Def maintains her innocence, Def is agreeing that there is strong proof of guilt.  Court reviews facts/evidence pointing to Def's guilt.  Def addresses the Court.

Court notes that competency was challenged; report was received by DHS, indicating that def is competent to stand trial.  State and Defense confirm findings of the report.  Court finds def is competent and continues to proceed with review of facts/evidence of the State.  

Court finds there is strong evidence of guilt.  Further colloquy on plea.  Court finds def has entered her plea freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.  Court enters finding of guilty and orders pre-sentence investigation with agent who writes PSI to be present in-person at sentencing.  

Atty. Longacre states that defense would like their own PSI; he's working with SPD office re that matter.

Sentencing set for 2/16 at 9 - all day.  PSI's due 2/6.
Statement of Strong/Substantial Evidence of Guilt
Plea hearing on December 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Expert Witness Testimony
Department of Health Services

Final pre-trial on February 3, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial on February 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court for Defendant Nina V. Fields. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nina V. Fields in court, in custody.  DA states competency evaluation has been completed, finding that def is competent; asks for Court finding of the same. DA notes that motions and jury instructions are due 10/28; counsel have been communicating on those issues. Discussion re voir dire forms. Discussion re def's health and medications.  Matter adj. to allow Atty. L opportunity to speak with his client.

Matter recalled.  Trial adjournment requested for the reasons stated on the record.  Court sets jury trial as a #2 to State vs. Vine with dates for this case of 2/27-3/10 and a final pretrial of 2/3 at 3.
(faxed this date to WI Forensics Unit)
Status conference on October 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

1:25 p.m.  Defendant Nina V. Fields appeared by video means from WMH facility. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court for Defendant Nina V. Fields.  Atty. L requests competency evaluation in light of what has occurred; has concerns with def assisting her defense.  DA addresses the Court.  Court makes finding of probable cause; finds reason to doubt competency; orders comp. evaluation.  Clerk to draft order for either in-patient or out-patient eval; hopeful eval will be as soon as possible; sets further status for 10/25 at 10.  DA - State is still planning to prepare for trial as set; asks Court for permission with voir dire mailing; has talked with the clerk re summons timeline (clerk planning to summons by 10/17); notes motions are due by 10/28.  Atty. Longacre agrees with DA re written voir dire question process; willing to collaborate with DA re those questions.  Court permits voir dire questions to be sent out with jurors to be instructed that they are ordered to complete the questions and mail them back in.  Court wants to review the questions prior to them being sent out.  Court will require juror response by 11/4.  Court inquires about expert witness plans of defense.  Atty. Longacre addresses the Court.  Court states motions on such are to be in as soon as possible.  Further status set for 10/25 at 10.
Status conference on October 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

At request of the DA to accommodate trial scheduling in an unrelated matter, the Court has changed the jury trial dates in this matter.  Trial will now be set to begin on November 29th rather than November 28th.

Defendant Nina V. Fields in court, in custody, with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA - State has filed information containing one count of attempted first degree homicide.  Atty. Longacre - Defense waives formal reading.  Court states the possible max. penalties.  Atty. L enters NG plea on def's behalf.  Trial dates have already been set.  Jury trial to begin Nov. 28.  Court asks counsel if they anticipate filing of motions.  DA states she is waiting for information from FBI as well as histology report from State Lab of Hygiene.
Arraignment on May 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:40 p.m.  Defendant Nina V. Fields in court, in custody, with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. State calls witness Detective Jason Pilla.  JP sworn by the clerk and questioned on direct by DA Harper, on cross by Atty. Longacre, and again on redirect by DA Harper.  DA Harper asks for probable cause finding and bindover.  Atty. Longacre argues against bindover.  Court rules:  Probable cause found and bindover ordered on the attempted murder charge.  State asks for time to file the information - DA anticipates the information will bring forth additional charges.  Court sets arraignment for Monday, 5/9 at 1:30.  Bond continued.  Def remanded to the custody of the sheriff.  3:53 p.m.
State

Defendant Nina V. Fields in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M moves for substitution of attorney; SPD will be appointing new counsel (Longacre) if the Court so approves.  Def confirms that is her wish.  Court's colloquy with def re def's request to change attorneys.  Court allows change of counsel.  Atty. Longacre, present in the courtroom, agrees to take the case.  Scheduling, as previously set, remains the same.
Status conference on April 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Status conference at 11-02-2016 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 11-18-2016 02:00 pm.
Jury trial at 11-28-2016 08:30 am.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Nina V. Fields. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nina V. Fields appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where she is in custody. Parties are requesting jury trial scheduling and estimate 3 weeks. DA is asking for fall scheduling. Atty. M states def wants it earlier. DA has suggested Nov. 28-Dec. 16. Atty. M says she has discussed with the def the reasons why trial may not be able to occur before late fall; states def is agreeable at this time to the trial beginning in Nov.  Court sets Nov. 28-Dec. 16 for jury trial.  Final pretrial will be 11/18 at 2 p.m.  Final status will be 11/2 at 11.  Prelim has already been set and will be held April 15 at 2:30.  Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Preliminary hearing at 04-15-2016 02:30 pm

DA and Atty McDougal jointly request preliminary hearing scheduling and removal of the status from 02/24/16 calendar.  COC office sets the prelim for 4/15.  Court will hold a scheduling conference on the jury trial dates on 2/24 at 1:30 during the time set aside for status.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Nina V. Fields. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nina V. Fields appeared by video means.  Atty. M states the bulk of discovery has been received but a few items remain; asks for another status in 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nina V. Fields in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA requests adjournment of the prelim; still in the discovery phase; prelim had been set for this Friday, Oct. 16th.  Atty. M states that def is willing to waive prelim time limits.  Court's colloquy with def.  Def waives right to prelim time limits.  Atty. M asks Court to give DA 30 days for discovery transmission; suggests further status on Nov. 6th at 2.  Prelim taken off the calendar at this point; prelim rescheduling not set; will be further considered on Nov. 6th.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing at 10-16-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Nina V. Fields in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M waives formal reading of the complaint.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as her right to prelim.  Atty. M request prelim scheduling; waives time limits but asks that it be held close to the 10-day limits; suggests Friday, October 16th.  Court sets prelim for 10/16 at 10 and conducts colloquy with def re waiver of 10-day time limits.  Waiver accepted.  Def remanded to the custody of the sheriff.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
